Class DropletType

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.digitalocean.resource.DropletType
public final class DropletType extends Object
Droplet types.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • DropletType

      public DropletType(DropletType.Id id, int ramInMiB, int cpus, int diskInMiB, BigDecimal transferInGiB, BigDecimal pricePerHour, BigDecimal pricePerMonth, Set<Zone.Id> zones, boolean available, String description, Set<DropletType.DiskDetails> diskDetails, DropletType.GpuDetails gpuDetails)
      Creates a new instance.
      Parameters:
      id - the type's ID
      ramInMiB - the amount of RAM allocated to this type, in MiB
      cpus - the number of virtual CPUs allocated to this type. Note that vCPUs are relative units specific to each vendor's infrastructure and hardware. A number of vCPUs is relative to other vCPUs by the same vendor, meaning that the allocation and performance are comparable within the same vendor's environment.
      diskInMiB - the amount of disk space allocated to this type, in GiB
      transferInGiB - the amount of outgoing network traffic allocated to this type, in GiB
      pricePerHour - the hourly cost of this Droplet type in US dollars. This cost is incurred as long as the Droplet is active and has not been destroyed.
      pricePerMonth - the monthly cost of this Droplet type in US dollars. This cost is incurred as long as the Droplet is active and has not been destroyed.
      zones - the zones where this type of Droplet may be created
      available - true if Droplets may be created with this type, regardless of the zone
      description - a description of this type. For example, Basic, General Purpose, CPU-Optimized, Memory-Optimized, or Storage-Optimized.
      diskDetails - more details about the disks available to this type
      gpuDetails - (optional) more details about the GPU available to this type, or null if absent
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the mandatory arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if description contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty

  • Method Details

    • id

      public static DropletType.Id id(String value)
      Creates a new ID.
      Parameters:
      value - the server-side identifier (slug)
      Returns:
      the type-safe identifier for the resource
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if value contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty

    • getAll

      public static Set<DropletType> getAll(DigitalOceanClient client) throws IOException, InterruptedException, TimeoutException
      Returns all the Droplet types that are available for creating Droplets.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      Returns:
      an empty set if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getAll

      public static Set<DropletType> getAll(DigitalOceanClient client, boolean canCreateDroplets) throws IOException, InterruptedException, TimeoutException
      Returns all the Droplet types.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      canCreateDroplets - true if the returned types must be able to create Droplets
      Returns:
      an empty set if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getByPredicate

      public static DropletType getByPredicate(DigitalOceanClient client, Predicate<DropletType> predicate) throws IOException, InterruptedException, TimeoutException
      Returns the first Droplet type that matches a predicate.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      predicate - the predicate
      Returns:
      null if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getCpus

      public int getCpus()
      Returns the number of virtual CPUs allocated to this type. Note that vCPUs are relative units specific to each vendor's infrastructure and hardware. A number of vCPUs is relative to other vCPUs by the same vendor, meaning that the allocation and performance are comparable within the same vendor's environment.
      Returns:
      the number of virtual CPUs

    • getPricePerHour

      public BigDecimal getPricePerHour()
      Returns the hourly cost of this Droplet type in US dollars. This cost is incurred as long as the Droplet is active and has not been destroyed.
      Returns:
      the cost per hour

    • getPricePerMonth

      public BigDecimal getPricePerMonth()
      Returns the monthly cost of this Droplet type in US dollars. This cost is incurred as long as the Droplet is active and has not been destroyed.
      Returns:
